title: Esteghlal Jonoub Tehran S.C.
text:
Esteghlal Jonoub Tehran Sport Club (), commonly known as Esteghlal Jonoub, isa <a href="sports%20club">sports club</a> based in <a href="Tehran">Tehran</a>, <a href="Iran">Iran</a>. The club is known for their football team. The club was founded in 1990.
History.
Establishment.
Founded in 1990 by fans of <a href="Esteghlal%20F.C.">Esteghlal Tehran</a>, Esteghlal Jonoub Tehran SC was officially registered in 2000. Besides football the club also consists of various other departments including <a href="Sport%20of%20athletics">athletics</a>, <a href="basketball">basketball</a>, <a href="handball">handball</a>, <a href="table%20tennis">table tennis</a>, <a href="volleyball">volleyball</a>, <a href="taekwondo">taekwondo</a>, <a href="Olympic%20weightlifting">weightlifting</a> and <a href="wrestling">wrestling</a>.
League 2.
Between 2007 and 2011 Esteghlal Jonoub played in <a href="League%202%20%28Iran%29">League 2</a>, formerly known as Iran Football's 2nd Division. In 2011 Esteghlal Jonoub were promoted to the <a href="Azadegan%20League">Azadegan League</a>. They finished 1st of Group B in <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Iran%20Football%27s%202nd%20Division">2010–11 Iran Football's 2nd Division</a>. However, in August 2011 the license of the club in the Azadegan League was bought by <a href="Esteghlal%20Khuzestan%20F.C.">Esteghlal Khuzestan</a>.
League 3.
After <a href="Esteghlal%20Khuzestan%20F.C.">Esteghlal Khuzestan</a> bought the license of Esteghlal Jonoub, the club was offset in <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Iran%20Football%27s%203rd%20Division">2011–12 Iran Football's 3rd Division</a>. They finished 3rd of Group 3 in that season.
Dissolution.
on July 19, 2018, the club was sold and named <a href="Persepolis%20Pakdasht%20F.C.">Pesepolis Pakdasht</a>.
Stadium.
Esteghlal Jonoub plays their home games at their own Esteghlal Jonoub Stadium which is located in the Shahid Rajaei Street. The stadium has an artificial turf.
